result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Seitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Seitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J Seitz was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (7th, 8th or 9th), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentences serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is approved for any programs.

records.addlTxt:
8:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Seitz in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Michael J Seitz.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard.  
State is heard on sentencing agreement. State recommends removing the minor enhancer. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty. Court accepts the defendants guilty plea and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant guilty. 

State moves to dismiss count 2 and 3.  Court dismisses counts 2 and 3. 
State is heard on sentence. 
Attorney Richards is heard on sentencing and agrees with the states recommendations. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders:

Ct1 - 346.63(1)(am) - Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance; 6 yrs prison - 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision. Consecutive to any other sentences serving. Eligible for any programs defendant can take advantage of. Eligible for Challenge and Substance abuse program. No fine. Court costs. 


Ct 2 - 343.44(1)(b) - Operating While Revoked (DISMISSED)
Ct 3 - 961.41(3g)(g) - Possession of Methamphetamine (DISMISSED)

9:03 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Michael J Seitz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Michael J Seitz.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. Finds probable cause to bind defendant over for further proceedings.

Atty Richards wishes to proceed to arraignment today. Have a resolution and would like a plea/sentencing date ASAP
Information filed with court at this time
Atty Richards waives reading, def. enters NOT GUILTY  pleas as to all 3 counts

Clerk directed to enter pleas of NOT GUILTY as to all three counts
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing

4:13 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Seitz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards in court for Michael J Seitz.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Steven G. Richards
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Steven Richards
Initial Appearance was rescheduled from 8/19/22 to 8/24/22 at the request of Atty. Steven Richards. LR assisted in rescheduling.

1:34 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Michael J Seitz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Prohibits defendant from driving. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Prohibits defendant from driving. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Prohibits defendant from driving.
